Node.definition: = a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= man, probably to be identified with Xerxes; ◄ son of Darius (דָּרְיָוֶשׁ) I; ► king of Persia (פָּרַס) husband of Vashti (וַשְׁתִּי) and Esther (אֶסְתֵּר)

= woman whose Hebrew name was Hadassah (הֲדַסָּה) ◄ cousin of Mordecai (מָרְדֳּכַי) ► married Xerxes (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ) and so became queen Esther of Persia (פָּרַס) and helped save the Jews from extermination
= female, foreign ruler of a nation or area

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= man; ◄ son of Hammedatha (הַמְּדָתָא) descendant of Agag (אֲגַג) ► he tried to exterminate all Jews in the kingdom of Persia (פָּרַס)
= person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others
= member of tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) inhabitant of the kingdom of Judah; after the exile referring to all descendants of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

= man; ◄ son of Jair (יָאִיר) cousin of Esther (אֶסְתֵּר); tribe of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) ► adopted Esther (אֶסְתֵּר) after the death of her parents and later succeeded Haman (הָמָן) as vizier under Xerxes (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= a small circular band with an engraved design on the top; ◄ usually made of gold; ► worn on the finger and used as a marker of identity as well as for personal adornment; ≈ regarded as valuable and attractive
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= man; ◄ son of Hammedatha (הַמְּדָתָא) descendant of Agag (אֲגַג) ► he tried to exterminate all Jews in the kingdom of Persia (פָּרַס)

= man; ◄ son of Jair (יָאִיר) cousin of Esther (אֶסְתֵּר); tribe of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) ► adopted Esther (אֶסְתֵּר) after the death of her parents and later succeeded Haman (הָמָן) as vizier under Xerxes (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ)

Node.gloss: to place (in a position) > to appoint
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities give (other) humans a certain task or responsibility

= woman whose Hebrew name was Hadassah (הֲדַסָּה) ◄ cousin of Mordecai (מָרְדֳּכַי) ► married Xerxes (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ) and so became queen Esther of Persia (פָּרַס) and helped save the Jews from extermination

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= man; ◄ son of Jair (יָאִיר) cousin of Esther (אֶסְתֵּר); tribe of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) ► adopted Esther (אֶסְתֵּר) after the death of her parents and later succeeded Haman (הָמָן) as vizier under Xerxes (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ)
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= man; ◄ son of Hammedatha (הַמְּדָתָא) descendant of Agag (אֲגַג) ► he tried to exterminate all Jews in the kingdom of Persia (פָּרַס)
= process by which an action is repeated or continued

= woman whose Hebrew name was Hadassah (הֲדַסָּה) ◄ cousin of Mordecai (מָרְדֳּכַי) ► married Xerxes (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ) and so became queen Esther of Persia (פָּרַס) and helped save the Jews from extermination

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= action by which humans assume a lying position, often in order to show respect, allegiance, or devotion

= the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and by extension of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

Node.gloss: to cry|to weep|to lament|to mourn|to bewail
Node.definition: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

Node.gloss: to beg for mercy|to make supplication
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans try to win a favorable attitude from deities or from other humans ◄ by approaching that deity or person in a very humble way

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
= man; ◄ son of Hammedatha (הַמְּדָתָא) descendant of Agag (אֲגַג) ► he tried to exterminate all Jews in the kingdom of Persia (פָּרַס)
= descendant of Agag (אֲגָגִי)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which humans or deities exercise their minds in order to determine a course of action that will achieve a certain purpose
= member of tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) inhabitant of the kingdom of Judah; after the exile referring to all descendants of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= action by which humans stretch their arm in a certain direction
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a staff carried by kings as a symbol of their authority
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

= woman whose Hebrew name was Hadassah (הֲדַסָּה) ◄ cousin of Mordecai (מָרְדֳּכַי) ► married Xerxes (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ) and so became queen Esther of Persia (פָּרַס) and helped save the Jews from extermination
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
literally: to find favor; hence: = state in which humans find the approval of deities or (other) humans
= state in which humans have a positive and compassionate attitude towards other humans
= state in which a matter is considered to be the appropriate thing to do
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= state in which humans and deities have character, integrity, and good fortune
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= causative action by which humans create a written document, such as a letter, book, or song
literally: to cause a letter to come back; hence: = causative action by which humans declare a letter that they have sent null and void, as if it has not been sent

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= written document; made of papyrus or parchment; either as a single sheet or several sheets sewn together and rolled for storage
= procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind
= man; ◄ son of Hammedatha (הַמְּדָתָא) descendant of Agag (אֲגַג) ► he tried to exterminate all Jews in the kingdom of Persia (פָּרַס)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ► father of Haman (הָמָן) who tried to exterminate all Jews in the kingdom of Persia (פָּרַס)
= descendant of Agag (אֲגָגִי)
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which humans create a written document, such as a letter, book, or song

= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= member of tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) inhabitant of the kingdom of Judah; after the exile referring to all descendants of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= an adminstrative division of a country or a city
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= referent to the way in which an event is performed; ► normally with the intention of finding out how, but often used in rhetorical questions in order to express one's conviction that that event in question cannot be performed at all (under the given circumstances)
= state in which humans or deities have the ability to tolerate or undergo a certain activity

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
literally: (an event) finds (people); = process by which humans eventually undergo a certain event, ◄ as if that event had been searching for them

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= process of removing people from existence; ◄ by means of aggression and violence
= the community where a person was born and grew up

literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message

literally: by the hand (of someone); hence: = process by which a certain event is carried out by an intermediary (person) or instrument (object)

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot
= action by which humans ride on a domestic animal such as a donkey (חֲמֹור) or a horse (סוּס) or in a chariot (מֶרְכָּבָה)
= a fast horse (סוּס) selectively bred for speed
= state in which something is in possession of a king; ≈ associated with great importance and high quality and value
= direct offspring of animals, either male or indeterminate
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

Node.gloss: to destroy|to exterminate|to wipe out|to demolish
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, deities, or events completely remove humans, animals, or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment
= causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= an organized military force equipped for fighting on land; this term denotes primarily the foot soldiers, though it can also be used to refer to the entire fighting force, including chariots and horsemen
= an adminstrative division of a country or a city

Node.gloss: to show hostility to|to attack|to harass
Node.definition: = action by which humans treat other humans with hostility

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= children dependent on their mothers for care; ≈ in this sense usually occurring in a variant of the expression טַף וְנָשִׁים children and women, often with possessives, indicating their belonging to families headed by an adult male; ≈ associated with vulnerability and lack of strength
= woman as a social class, to be distinguished from the men and the children
= action by which someone takes all sorts of goods (including people and animals) by force from an enemy in war

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= an adminstrative division of a country or a city
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= man, probably to be identified with Xerxes; ◄ son of Darius (דָּרְיָוֶשׁ) I; ► king of Persia (פָּרַס) husband of Vashti (וַשְׁתִּי) and Esther (אֶסְתֵּר)
= state in which a countable entity is three in number
= period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon
= state in which a countable entity is two in number
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon
= month, equivalent to period February/March; ► post exilic
= written specimen of a document, used only for royal decrees
= a written document, written on an unspecified surface
= a rule or directive made and maintained by someone in authority
= an adminstrative division of a country or a city
= an adminstrative division of a country or a city
= process by which certain information becomes publicly available
= member of tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) inhabitant of the kingdom of Judah; after the exile referring to all descendants of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= state in which someone is prepared for an event

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
= action by which humans ride on a domestic animal such as a donkey (חֲמֹור) or a horse (סוּס) or in a chariot (מֶרְכָּבָה)
= a fast horse (סוּס) selectively bred for speed
= state in which something is in possession of a king; ≈ associated with great importance and high quality and value

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= action by which humans or divine beings cause (other) humans to act quickly
= process by which an action is performed with more urge and speed than usual
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= a rule or directive made and maintained by someone in authority
= town; ► capital of Persia (פָּרַס)
= a fortress that commands a city and is used in the control of the inhabitants and in defense during attack or siege.

= man; ◄ son of Jair (יָאִיר) cousin of Esther (אֶסְתֵּר); tribe of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) ► adopted Esther (אֶסְתֵּר) after the death of her parents and later succeeded Haman (הָמָן) as vizier under Xerxes (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ)

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= generic designation for any article of clothing
= woven material, dyed reddish purple with a substance obtained from the murex shellfish
= white cloth; ◄ woven out of either linen or cotton; ► used for making clothes or to decorate the house; ≈ regarded as valuable and therefore symbolizing high status

= circular or semi circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity
= state in which an event has a high intensity

= high quality woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of cloth and clothes; worn by the rich and by priests and Levites; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness
= woven material, dyed reddish purple with a substance obtained from the murex shellfish

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= town; ► capital of Persia (פָּרַס)
= action by which humans shout ◄ for joy or because of grief ► to give vent to their feelings
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= member of tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) inhabitant of the kingdom of Judah; after the exile referring to all descendants of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
= state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and worthy of appreciation and respect
= an adminstrative division of a country or a city
= an adminstrative division of a country or a city

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= a rule or directive made and maintained by someone in authority
literally: to reach; hence: = process by which a certain event reaches the time for it to take place
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
= member of tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) inhabitant of the kingdom of Judah; after the exile referring to all descendants of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
literally: drinking; hence: = a banquet meal or feast with honored guests

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: to become a Jew|to make oneself a Jew
Node.definition: = action or process by which someone presents oneself as a יְהוּדִי Jew, or makes oneself a Jew, ► which could suggest a temporary profession of convenience but more likely means adopting their customs, including, as explicitly states, circumcision
literally: to fall (upon someone); hence: = process by which humans are affected by a certain condition, emotion, or supernatural influence
= process by which someone experiences extreme fear, ► which may be accompanied by visible symptoms such as trembling
= member of tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) inhabitant of the kingdom of Judah; after the exile referring to all descendants of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
